result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael D Sellers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: - AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.

- No alcohol. 
- No contact with Amazon fulfillment center in Oak Creek.

- Provide a DNA sample due by 9-2-2022 by 3:00pm
- Court set restitution at zero. 
- Defendant to pay all non-waivable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharges during the period of probation. 
- Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay. 
- Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael D Sellers

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael D Sellers in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Michael D Sellers.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 2.  

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 1 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  


Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing. Additional statement by Jaila H.

Court sentenced the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 6 days served. Huber for work. Court STAYED the sentence(s) and placed the defendant on probation for 8 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- No alcohol.
- No contact with Amazon fulfillment center in Oak Creek.
- Provide a DNA sample due by 9-2-2022 by 3:00 pm

Defendant to pay all non-waivable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

- Court set restitution at zero.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights.

Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief 
Pretrial Incarceration Credit 
Sentencing Referral Form

Defendant Michael D Sellers in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a calendar call. Defendant appears. Court cancelled stayed warrant. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.
Case adjourned.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Sam Obscherning in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a plea and sentencing. No appearance by the defendant.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed until the next court date.  Case adjourned to Br. 30.  Calendar call scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael D Sellers in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael D Sellers appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for stauts. Defense requests plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned back to Br 30.

Defendant Michael D Sellers in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael D Sellers appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests status conference by zoom.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Status conference scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Michael D Sellers in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Michael D Sellers in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael D Sellers appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
